text: English has many proverbs, short and well-known phrases giving a piece of useful advice or common sense.
For example, the proverb actions speak louder than words.
Means that what people do is more important than what they say.
And the proverb don't judge a book by its cover.
It advises people not to form opinions about people based on how they look.
Proverbs are found in many cultures and languages and are often passed down through the
generations to teach children lessons in life.
One famous English proverb is an apple a day keeps the doctor away.
In other words, eating fresh fruit is good for you.
